pullRequest.title: Merge cosmos v4 to master
pullRequest.bodyText:
Merges v4 to master  - WITH RETAINING HISTORY
Java code v4 to local branch merge is successful.
Updated log4j version code change applied. (This was updated in v3, so had to pull this in the merge)
Guava dependency reduced to 25-0.jre. (Didn't want to do this, but had to because of merge)
Client - Track - 2 most of the changes are done. (adding cosmos sdk to various parent poms pom.client.xml, mandatory to have unit tests running on java 8 and java 11 - for all three windows, mac, linux)
Dependency section updated for cosmos sdk. (eng/versioning/versions update).
Skipped revapi
Skipped README
Skipped Changelog
Parent pom removal
jacoco test coverage added (currently at 10%)

commit.message: Setting the code coverage percentage to 10% as a workaround for now
Updated code coverage percentage to 1% for benchmark and examples
Fixed typo

nodes.bodyText: It's worth mentioning here that this test matrix, for the unit tests, brings Cosmos v4 inline with the test matrix used for client track (Linux/Mac/Windows with Java versions 8 and 11). The "from source" build is a special run that was added a while back that manipulates the versions such that all track client track dependencies are built from the latest source. This is a safeguard to ensure compatibility with changes being made to inter track dependencies.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5,21 +5,54 @@ parameters:
 stages:
   - stage: Build
     jobs:
-    - template: ../jobs/archetype-sdk-data.yml
+    - template: ../jobs/archetype-sdk-client.yml
       parameters:
         ServiceDirectory: ${{parameters.ServiceDirectory}}
         SDKType: ${{parameters.SDKType}}
         Artifacts: ${{parameters.Artifacts}}
         TestMatrix:
-          Windows - java8:
+          Linux - Java 8:

nodes.bodyText:
/CC @joshfree @alzimmermsft
Alan and I have chatted about these netty dependencies. Right now the Cosmos io.netty dependencies are ahead of the common versions. We should look and see if we can bring the common dependencies up to these versions.

Right now, the goal is to get Comos v4 into master and successfully building in the pipelines which will unblock the development. There are still source changes that need to get made per the arch board review that will not be part of this PR. @kushagraThapar and I agreed that tagging things in the pom files, like plugin overrides or things that are temporary, with "CosmosSkip" so they can be easily identified. It is my understanding that everything tagged with CosmosSkip is going to be attached to a work item which is to be completed before GA.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -428,6 +428,10 @@
               *.implementation*:
               com.azure.tools.checkstyle*
             </excludePackageNames>
+            <!-- CosmosSkip - This is temporary, BridgeInternal gets converted to implementation -->

commit.message: Added jacoco test coverage entry, fixed logger test

Added profiles to benchmark and examples, as some of the tests from benchmark and examples were not running as they didn't have profile
Added testng xml files for test suites, modified pom files to refer these suites

Cosmos v4: ChangeFeedProcessor fix for load-balancing leases (#6430)

* Ported fix for bug reported by Walmart where an exception issued by the change feed processor when read replicas are lagging behind the primary can exit the loop earlier and stop the processing.
The fix is to "catch all" exception handler to keep the loop going until the user stops the change feed processor.

removed regex in rntbd, added afterburner to rntbd objectmapper (#8117)

- Replace regex String.split() with non regex StringUtils.split() (the rationale is regex is expensive)
- Registered jackson after-burner module to rntbd for improving serialization/deserialization (this is based on jackson perf guide and as per my measurement in general improves serialization/deserialization perf by 10%, I noticed some of the rntbd components are using jackson for informational debugging info. So this improves the perf for serializing those debugging constructs rather than the actual data.

nodes.bodyText: FWIW we still recommend having a root level README file that describes the set of packages in the folder. Something like https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/tree/master/sdk/storage/README.md
